name: Duodo Palace Hotel

reviews.title: Great Location, OK rooms
reviews.text: The Duodo Palace is very close to San Marco. If you arrive with big luggage it's a bit of a walk from the pier (check out duodopalacehotel for directions - there's a map)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a decent size, but filled with unnecessary furniture. We would rather have had one more suitcase stand than the armchair! The bathroom was of good size, the shower cubicle was tiny. There was a safe, and the beds were ok. The location was really the best part of this hotel. Walking distance to many sights and also lot of reasonable restaurants nearby. Our room didn't include breakfast (on arrival we were told 50euro pp!!) We had breakfast at a little cafe on Frezzeria every morning. They serve the best cappucino and sandwiches (worked out to 11euro for 2 of us!)...look out for the naughty calendars on the wall!
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — The staff could have been a bit more out going. It was our honeymoon but that didn't seem to matter much to them!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: We were married in Ravello Italy and spent 7 nights in Positano and 5 nights in Florence and then 4 nights in Venice for our honeymoon.
reviews.title: A very lovely hotel.

likes.disliked: — Confusing to find - especially on foot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Duodo Palace. It was easy to get to by water taxi. The room was small but very clean. The shower a bit small. The location was perfect once we understood our way around it was easy to navigate. At night I would hang out my window and listen to the music of the gondolas going by, It was very romantic.
reviews.title: Bed bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff left a little to be desired… They did give us help when prompt but made us feel like we were more of a bother. They always said hello/bonn giorno or goodbye/arrivederci. But it was somewhat robotic. They weren’t very warm but then most of the people in Venice came across that way. The personality of the people in Southern Italy is much different than those of Northern Italy. I’m not sure if we were just spoiled by the warm friendly people on the Amalfi coast and expected more in Venice.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, excellent location!
We loved the Duodo!
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel in a great location just a short walk from St Mark's square and the Rialto bridge. The room we had was quite large with beautiful decor and views over the rooftops of Venice. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast with plenty of choice. It is quite difficult to find this hotel but the best option is to go to the Fenice Opera House and look towards the top left hand side of the square where there is a small plaque on the wall directing you down a lane to the hotel. This was our first visit to Venice and we would certainly return to this hotel.

reviews.title: Delightful Duodo
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in Sep 2005 with my husband and 12 yo daughter. A very elelgant hotel with georgeous rooms and fittings. Rooms are also large for Europe. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive and the breakfast was very good. The hotel is situated on a canal and is only a short walk from the Piazza. Added bonus, complimentary internet access in the foyer. We also got terribly lost trying to find this hotel - the lane it is on is not on the standard Venezia tourist map! I recommend that you catch a vaporetto to San Marco, then go to the tourist office and get detailed directions. Overall, if you want somewhere stylish, comfortable and reasonably priced (for Europe) - Duodo Palace fits the bill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel back in July 2005. It took us ages to find the hotel (make sure you take a decent map as none of the locals knew where the street it is on was) but when we did we were very impressed. The hotel is beautiful inside, typical venetian decor, and is in an amazing location just a walk away from St Mark Square. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast lovely. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I returned to Venice.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and brillant location
A wonderful hotel
reviews.text: The Duodo Palace was a wonderful hotel and we would recommend it highly. It was a bit difficult to find, but if we would have printed the internet directions from the hotel website, I think we would have been fine. Looking at them afterwards, we could have saved ourselves a bit of frustration!

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel
reviews.text: Our room was off of the lobby and had a view of the canal. It didn't have the fresco ceilings as other rooms have been described, but the room was a nice size and after the small bathroom we had in Rome, this bathroom was huge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We traveled to Venice on the Orient Express and when we arrived were taken in a motorboat to the Duodo Palace, it looks exactly as it does on the website. We were greeted by a courteous, helpful receptionist, our baggage taken to our room (which was the pink one on the home page) The room was sumptuous and the painted ceiling was beautiful and, as others have said the bathroom huge! We found our way around fairly easily after the first night and found the central location a huge bonus. The breakfasts were always good and the service prompt and polite. There are several nearby restaurants that we enjoyed. We both totally recommend this hotel and Venice to anyone!!
reviews.title: Amazing Holiday
Ripe for Romance!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and were very impressed with every aspect of the hotel. Room overlooked the canal where singing gondoliers passed by frequently during the daytime. What a delight! Hotel staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Breakfast was in a very pleasant room next to the canal with a sufficient range of the usual fare in enough quantity to set you up for the day. The hotel was very clean and our room was tidied, cleaned and restocked by the time we got back after lunch. The hotel is a five minute walk fron St Mark's square and the Rialto Bridge, but manages to be extremely quiet of an evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay, great staff & pretty Hotel
Fabulous
reviews.text: The staff was very agreeable and accomdating, room was small, but the bathroom was large and modern, the view was a courtyard. The pictures of the bedroom (on the web site) was a bit misleading, ours was very plain. The breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff was informative. The resturant in Fenice Square (Antic Martini) was excellent. The location is near everything and yet off the beaten path. We had three wonderful days in Venice and will return again & again.

reviews.title: Loved our stay
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Duodo Palace for two nights in April. We found it to be a delightful hotel. On our first trip to Venice we stayed in a hotel on the Grand Canal, but the that one did not begin to compare with the lovely Duodo Palace. We actually preferred the location of the Duodo. It is close enough to the main sights without being too close. We loved the quiet Campo near the hotel. Not only is the Duodo a beautiful property, but the staff is eager to be helpful to the guests. We are looking forward to returning to Venice and the Duodo Palace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reviews of this hotel I had some misgivings especially about being able to find it. I now have no misgivings at all. We took the Aliliguana from the airport and got off at San Marco. Took about 10 minutes total to find the hotel due to me doubting my map reading skills. If I went with my gut feeling it would have taken less than 5 minutes. Room was clean, modern, and good size. Staff was very helpful. Best part was location, location, location. We would without a doubt stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

likes.disliked: — Expensive breakfast which we did not partake.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Duodo Palace Mar '08 and was really hard to find but turned out to be a great hotel. The room was ok but had really low ceilings. Other than that...the hotel was nice; front desk was helpful and seemed to have 4 star ammenities. It's really close to the Piazza San Marco and Ponte Rialto.
reviews.title: Great place

likes.disliked: — had trouble with early check out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from venice having stayed in the Duodo Palace hotel. We were in room 101 which did not have lift access to it,as it was a room that seemed to be between floors. The flight of stairs did not bother us but it could be an issue for some.
reviews.title: Had a very enjoyable stay at the Duodo Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was in good condition and the bathroom was very spacious, and we couldnt fault it. I felt the location was good as it was only about 10mins from the waterbus stop that came straight from the airport. It was also close to St Marks Square.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only fault we really had with the hotel was with the breakfast (it was inculded in our package otherwise we wouldn't have bothered with it at all). For a four star Hotel the quality was very poor, and we had to request for items to be replaced instead of this happenind automatically.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Great time at the Duodo
reviews.text: Ah venice, what a place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Duodo was in a quiet spot within a 10 minute stroll to San Marco and other attractions such as shops etc.
reviews.title: I loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some words of advice though... If you arrive late in the evening I would diffinately take the option of a private water taxi rather than the vaporetto (water bus) option.
reviews.title: Duodo Palace, Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the bus as it was 20euro compared to 60 but it took ages and dropped us off at San Marco from where we had to navigate over bridges and through dark streets until we finally found the Duodo tucked away in it's own niche.
reviews.title: Great location, shame about the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Not the best or least stressed introduction to one of the most beautiful cities in the world.
reviews.title: Great location and price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and myself have just returned from a weekend in Venice and it was wonderful. We stayed at the Duodo Palace and we had a beautiful room with a balcony and views over the canal. The room was very spacious and decorated in a traditional venetian style. The staff at reception and the bar area were attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We had read some reviews that said the breakfast was not good but we can honestly say it was one of the nicest continental breakfasts we have had with plenty of variety. There was an additional menu for cooked items but these were expensive. The hotel is positioned in a perfect place for the main sightseeing i.e. St Marks Square and The Rialto Bridge but always ask for a map from reception because it takes a little getting used to because the streets look the same. We had a private water taxi from the airport straight to the hotel which was really lovely but they are expensive 100 euros one way. The restaurants were all pretty good and all the meals we had were very nice but they can work out expensive especially if drinking alcohol as well. If we decide to go back to Venice we will definitely stay at the Duodo Palace again it was impossible to fault it in any way and we really enjoyed it. We hope this review has been helpful.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel

likes.liked: — the spacious room, lovely view and decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a one night stay at the Duodo Palace after our Cruise returned to Venice. We had to pay alot (130 euro ) for the water taxi to get us their from the port because it is down a canal that is hard to get to. The front desk were not friendly. Our room faced the back of the hotel with no view. Upon checkout in the morning we were told we owed 40 euro for the Contienental breakfast that was listed as free on the menu in the room. We tried to argue the point that breakfast we ordered was on the free colum on the menu but to no avail they did not back down and we paid it so we could make our flight home. Would not recommend this hotel. unfriendly staff!!
reviews.title: Not happy with Duodo Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Duodo Palace Hotel from 21st to 24th December. We took a water taxi from the airport as we had a late flight. The water taxi cost 90 Euro but was well worth it. We arrived at the hotel around 11.00pm. The hotel staff were very welcoming - we had read reviews that said the staff were not very friendly but we found the opposite. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was simple but good and the staff were very attentive.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Amazingly central
reviews.text: Our room (Room 108) overlooked the canal and was very spacious and luxurious with a lovely bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated between the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square - both a few minutes walk away. We only had one small criticism and that was that the bar area could have been furnished with comfortable sofa's etc. rather than tables and chairs. We would have enjoyed a drink when we returned in the evening but as the area wasn't very 'cosy' we didn't bother. However, that was a very small criticism of an otherwise excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Good location and nice facility

likes.disliked: — Orbitz said breakfast was included but the hotel said it was not.

reviews.title: Worst hotel we have stayed in.
reviews.text: Obviously the hotel had overbooked and when we arrived we were placed in what can only be described as a cell. The room didnt appear to be part of the hotel and was about 100 yards away. We entered the room direct from an alley way. We were kept awake all night with the noise of people walking down the alley and dragging cases along the cobbles. On the second night we had the pleasure of what appeared to be a business above our room dragging furniture around. Despite various complaints to the staff we didnt get anywhere. This was supposed to be a special weekend for my 35th birthday arranged by my wife who was extremely upset that she had booked a 4 star hotel especially for the occasion and had researched the hotel following the excellent reviews on websites such as trip advisor. How wrong could you be. As the hotel was mainly full of older couples we can only assume that they had decided to keep the younger guests outside. Needless to say we do not recommend the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Listen up Americans. I've have stayed in many hotels and B&B's throughout the world and the Duodo Palace in Venice was great. Perfect location away from the crowds but centrally located. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Free intenet access and good breakfast. Stayed in junior suite with lots of space and modern conveniences. Staff was very friendly and all spoke english. Would stay there again and this was my second trip to Venice.
reviews.title: Nothing but praise for this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Duodo Palace and couldn't fault a thing. Our room 103 didn't overlook the canal but we didn't expect it to for the price (about £80 a night) when you consider you can easily spend that on a meal and wine at a reasonable restaurant in venice you realise what a good deal that is. The bedrooms were spotless and typically venetian with gold fabric walls and furnishings- the bathroom large and spotless. The location of the hotel is great 10min walk to Rialto,St Marks or accademia but still very quiet. The break fast is continentla in style, venetians don't eat breakast- you can buy eggs and bacon but they are a bit pricey, the breakfast included is fine so I wouldn't bother-I particularly liked the panettone- currant bread spread with butter. The hotel staff were really helpful and not snooty (which they can be in some places in venice- the unmissable cafe Florian in Piazza St Marco, for instance).
reviews.title: great hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: We ate at Gallileo just round the corner from the hotel on or first night and the food was excellent- if you like cheese we'd highly reccomend the ravioli gallileo- they have the typical four course meal but we didn't have all of them , a pasta and a main course is fine. It was a little pricey at 90 euros all in with a half bottle of wine but the quality and quantity of the seafood was worth it(tuna and seabass). We ate at a touristy place by Rialto in front of the rialto hotel as its so scenic by night and paid just a bit less but we only had pizzas but two fab starters, highly reccomend the melon and parma ham or the beef carpaccio here, you get loads - the pizzas were nice too and the wine not too bad price. We ate round the corner from the hotel at the teatro- the food was ok and seemed reasonably priced but when you add a 12.5% service charge and cover charge it added over £20 onto the bill. We wanted to eat at Da rafaelle on cala ostreghe but we picked the night it was closed ! that is something you need to watch as it seems to be a district thing in Venice- we also got caught out by trying to visit Peggy Guggenheim Art gallery on a Tuesday- don't it's closed. We only had 3 days so by the time we were back at the room couldn't be bothered to venture far but I'd try Dosodoro or SantaPolo/Croce as the restaurants there looked better value. We also walked down to Zattere which looks over Giudecca- there was a great view and some reasonable restaurants there too.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: As first time visitors (but not the last !)to Venice we did all the must dos- some tips........ get a ticket for the Palazzo Ducale- its fab and don't miss the Doges Apartments- if you think Versaille is opulent you need to see this- the same ticket at 11 euros covers you for the museum in St Marcs Square (the museo correr which is really good and is at the top of the square-the ticket also covers you for palazzo mocenigo)- if you go in the cafe in museo correr (and do nothing else from the cafe del arte you get the best and cheapest) view of St Marcos square and the coffee is reasonably priced. Also in the basement of the pallazo ducale( doge palace) there is a cafe where you can have a sandwich and watch the gondolas pass by through a window which is not far off water level- the only place we found to do this. Like all places in venice if you stand up the cost of what you have (food or drinks)is a third less than sitting down but hours on your feet means you soon give up on that one.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on a water taxi direct to the hotel, and shown to our room 307 which had a balcony and there were compliementary wine and fruit awaiting us.
reviews.title: wonderful place

likes.disliked: — the seating in the bar could have been more comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All the staff were very nice and helpful and during the day it was lovely to sit on the balcony and watch the gondielers go past singing etc.
reviews.title: Little gem of a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was fine and normal for europe hotels.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, No View From Room if You Want That

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to St Marks Square and the rialto bridge.
reviews.title: A conveninet place to stay..

description: Conveniently located in the heart of Venice, Duodo Palace Hotel is set within a historical building, and has been beautifully renovated and restored to create a new four-star hotel in Venice. Saving some of the most important architectural elements from this 600 year-old palazzo, including the frescoed ceilings in each bedroom, the hotel has a truly Venetian feel. Literally located a stone’s throw from La Fenice, the hotel could not be more centrally located. You can stroll to San Marco Square, the Rialto Bridge, or the Accademia, in 10 minutes or less. The top floor accommodations offer sweeping views of the city’s rooftops and major monuments. Glance below and you can watch a gondola slowly glide by your window. Offering direct access to the hotel from the canal, your water taxi can drop you at the door of the Duodo Palace Hotel where you will be warmly greeted by the staff. The hotel’s 38 bedrooms, adorned with beautiful Venetian fabrics, offer the modern amenities required by today’s traveler, including fully marble baths and plush towels. Relax in the cozy bar, or enjoy a book in the study that has the remains of a piscine - an ancient well - where you can almost hear the voices from the past as they share the day’s gossip Welcome to Venice
